purpleculture_pinyin:
qū
human body
тело человека
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 躯)
Pictophonetic: 區 indicates the sound; 身 (body) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
軀體 [ qū tǐ ]: body; carcass
軀幹 [ qū gàn ]: trunk; torso
軀殼 [ qū qiào ]: the body (housing the soul)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 身 [ shēn ] body, torso; person; pregnancy
    • 區 [ qū ] area, district, region, ward; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: The somebody region is the human body, the region where somebody exists.
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the body (身) with the goods in the side open box (區) is a body
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: I may have an old human body, but I am somebody in this region (in this region I am somebody).
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " body " to the " zone " sound. The original meaning is body. "Shu Wen": "The body, the body. From the body, distinguish the sound." Such as "Chu Ci. "Nine Debates": "Wish to give an unworthy body and leave, and let your ambition be in the clouds." "Xunzi. "Encourage Learning": "Four inches of ears are enough for a leisurely speech, and it is enough to be seven feet beautiful!"

" Body " also means pregnancy. Such as "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Hua Tuo Biography": "His mother holds her body, Yang Qi is internally raised, her milk is cold, and her children get cold from the mother, so it heals from time to time." Wang Shuhe of the Western Jin Dynasty and "Mai Jing. Volume Nine: "Women have a body through self-determination, and their pulses are twisted, fearing that they will be severe afterwards."

" Body " can also be used as a quantifier, mostly used in buildings such as statues and pagodas. Such as the Northern Wei Dynasty Yang Xuanzhi's "Luoyang Jialan Ji. In the city. "Yongning Temple": "There is a Buddhist temple in the north of the floating figure, which is shaped like a Taiji temple. There is a gold statue in the middle, a golden statue in the middle and ten bodies, three bodies embroidered with beads, five bodies in gold, and two bodies in jade. ."Liang Shenyue of the Southern Dynasties "Records of King Jingling's Creation of Sakyamuni": "In the four years of Emperor Qi, the statue of Sakyamuni was made.
humanum_short_description_en: From the " body " to the " zone " sound. The original meaning is body.
humanum_full_description:
從「身」，「區」聲。本義是身體。《說文》：「軀，體也。从身，區聲。」如《楚辭．九辯》：「願賜不肖之軀而別離兮，放遊志乎雲中。」《荀子．勸學》：「口耳之閒則四寸耳，曷足以美七尺之軀哉！」

　　「軀」也表示身孕。如《三國志．魏書．華佗傳》：「其母懷軀，陽氣內養，乳中虛冷，兒得母寒，故令不時愈。」西晉王叔和《脈經．卷九》：「婦人經自斷而有軀，其脈反弦，恐其後必大下。」

　　「軀」還可作量詞，多用於神像、寶塔等建築物。如北魏楊衒之《洛陽伽藍記．城內．永寧寺》：「浮圖北有佛殿一所，形如太極殿。中有丈八金像一軀，中長金像十軀，繡珠像三軀，金織成五軀，玉像二軀。」南朝梁沈約〈竟陵王造釋迦像記〉：「以皇齊之四年日子，敬制釋迦像一軀。」

Story: I may have an old human body, but I am somebody in this region (in this region I am somebody).
Kind: traditional

從「 身 」，「 區 」聲。本義是身體。《說文》：「軀，體也。从身，區聲。」如《楚辭．九辯》：「願賜不肖之軀而別離兮，放遊志乎雲中。」《荀子．勸學》：「口耳之閒則四寸耳，曷足以美七尺之軀哉！」 「 軀 」也表示身孕。如《三國志．魏書．華佗傳》：「其母懷軀，陽氣內養，乳中虛冷，兒得母寒，故令不時愈。」西晉王叔和《脈經．卷九》：「婦人經自斷而有軀，其脈反弦，恐其後必大下。」 「 軀 」還可作量詞，多用於神像、寶塔等建築物。如北魏楊衒之《洛陽伽藍記．城內．永寧寺》：「浮圖北有佛殿一所，形如太極殿。中有丈八金像一軀，中長金像十軀，繡珠像三軀，金織成五軀，玉像二軀。」南朝梁沈約〈竟陵王造釋迦像記〉：「以皇齊之四年日子，敬制釋迦像一軀。」

" Body" can also be used as a quantifier, mostly used in buildings such as statues and pagodas. Such as the Northern Wei Dynasty Yang Xuanzhi's "Luoyang Jialan Ji. In the city. 軀字的基本解释

軀
qū
见“躯”。

軀字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qū］
［《廣韻》豈俱切，平虞，溪。］
“躯1”的繁体字。亦作“1”。
(1)身体。
(2)指生命。
(3)身孕。
(4)塑像单位名。犹言尊，座。
(5)通“驅”。鞭马前进。
(6)通“驅”。“軀口”的省称。

軀字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【身字部】　軀； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1238第05
【唐韻】豈俱切【集韻】【韻會】虧于切，?音區。【說文】體也。【釋名】軀，區也。是衆名之大，若區域也。【前漢·蓋寬饒傳】用不訾之軀。【荀子·勸學篇】曷足以美七尺之軀哉。【集韻】軀或作?。　又【韻補】叶祛尤切。【楊方·合歡詩】同聲好相應，同氣自相求。我情與子親，譬如影追軀。

軀字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
軀字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qū］
["Guangyun" Qi Juqi, Pingyu, Xi. ]
Traditional characters for "身1". Also called "1".
(1) Body.
(2) Refers to life.
(3) Pregnancy.
(4) The name of the statue unit. Still saying respect, seat.
(5) Through "drive". Whip the horse forward.
(6) Through "drive". The provincial name of "trunk".
